intro: Spermacoce decipiens, commonly known as the false spiderling, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, the Americas, and parts of Asia. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a schizocarp, consisting of two one-seeded carpels that split apart when mature. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
